video.title: Flutter Course - Full Tutorial for Beginners (Build iOS and Android Apps)
video.description:
Learn Flutter, Google’s groundbreaking multi-platform mobile development framework to create apps for Android and iOS. In this course, Nick Manning from fluttercrashcourse.com teaches you how to get up and running with Flutter quickly and effectively. Nick has been a Flutter engineer since 2017 and has boiled down this real-world know-how into a clear-cut, realistic and step-by-step crash course. Flutter apps are written in the Dart programming language

📽 Subscribe to Nick's YouTube channel: 
https://youtube.com/c/nickmanningdotdev

💻 Code - https://github.com/seenickcode/tourismandco
💻 Accompanying blog posts for each lesson - https://fluttercrashcourse.com/blog

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
(0:00) Intro:
⌨️ What this course covers

(2:15) Layout in Flutter:
⌨️ Layout concepts
⌨️ Column, mainAxisAlignment, crossAxisAlignment
⌨️ Container and Parameterized StatelessWidgets

(14:48) Images:
⌨️ Image, BoxConstraint
⌨️ Configuring image assets
⌨️ Implementing ImageBanner

(30:05) Text:
⌨️ Importing a custom font
⌨️ Finalizing our TextSection with Column and EdgeInsets
⌨️ ThemeData, TextTheme and organizing style

(48:30) Models:
⌨️ Using Models to represent data and functionality
⌨️ Making our screen dynamic
⌨️ Generics, map(), Anonymous Functions and Cascades

(69:33) Navigation and Lists:
⌨️ Parameterized named routes
⌨️ MaterialPageRoute, RouteFactory
⌨️ ListView and GestureDetector

⭐️ Links: ⭐️
🔗 Nick Manning’s Flutter Crash Course: https://fluttercrashcourse.com
🔗 Installing Flutter on macOS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=THsihXK1-14
🔗 Installing Flutter on Windows: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDlywQeg5Vs

⭐️ Social: ⭐️
🐤 Twitter: https://twitter.com/seenickcode
📬 Email: nick@fluttercrashcourse.com

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: kristifor milchev
topLevelComment.text: Great kick starter course, enjoyed it very much. I am a .net developer recently decided to give flutter a go and thanks to this i feel much more confident with it.

topLevelComment.author: mjmeans
topLevelComment.text: Is it possible to have an image, like a picture of a building floor plan, widget that has tappable buttons for areas of interest, like [1], [2], etc. where the quantity and locations of buttons are data driven instead of being hard coded? And, where no matter how the background image is scaled, the tappable buttons position and size themself so they are over the same areas of interest in the underlying image?

replies.author: Murrali Ramasamy
replies.text: @Syed Zulqarnain I have figured out the bug actually. Simply move the 'final arguments = settings.arguments as Map<String, dynamic>;' into the 'case LocationDetailRoute' clause.

topLevelComment.author: Chris Hornberger
topLevelComment.text: I really wish the Flutter team would take their collective head out of their collective butt about the idiocy of the underscore. Developers are most effective when they can move from project to project, which often means from platform to platform and language to language. They should just add similar scope definers like every other language. Underscores are awkward. And dumb.

topLevelComment.author: Hammad Pervez
topLevelComment.text:
Read my question it's important please, I'm currently working on an e-commerce project Having an issue with route navigation stacking
I've an appbar with cart action button
1) user tap on a product. It gets you to the  product detail and fetch it by ID.
2) on redirecting to  product detail, I pop HomeView.

3) when user tap on back button, I offPush  to home screen.
4)  when user is on cart screen from detail page and on tap of cart item it redirects to detail page and then pop it on back button press. 
Etc......

I'm currently using onRouteGenerator to manage my route navigation. But I don't know how can I recognize is it home page  I should redirect to or detail. When screen gets more nested and nested it's becomes a mass to handle. 

Sorry for the bad explanation

topLevelComment.text:
Anonymous တကွက်ထုတ်ပြလိုက်ပြီ

လွန်ခဲ့တဲ့ ရက်အနည်းငယ်က Anonymous ဟာ မြန်မာနိုင်ငံသားများအတွက် အမှန်တရားဖော်ထုတ်ပြီး စစ်အာဏာရှင်ကို တော်လှန်ဖို့ #OPMyanmar ဟုတ်ထုတ်ပြန်ပြီး ပါဝင်ခဲ့တာတွေ့ရပါတယ်။ တချိန်ထဲမှာပဲ သူတို့ဟာ အာဏာရှင်စစ်တပ်ကို သတိပေး ခြိမ်းခြောက်တဲ့ video ထုတ်ပြန်ခဲ့ပါတယ်။ ဒီကနေ့မှာလည်း Video အသစ်တခုထုတ်ပြန်ခဲ့တာ ထပ်မံတွေ့ရှိရပါတယ်။ Video ထွက်ပြီးနောက်မှာ သူတို့ဟာ File Size: 330.5 GB တောင်ရှိတဲ့ မြန်မာနိုင်ငံရဲ့ လျို့ဝှက်အချက်လက်များစွာကို ထုတ်ချပေးလိုက်ပါတယ်။ 

 File ထဲမှာပါဝင်လာတာတွေကတော့:

မြန်မာနိုင်ငံတွင် မှတ်ပုံတင်ထားသော ကုမ္ပဏီများနှင့် ကော်ပိုရေးရှင်းကြီးများ၏ သိန်းနှင့်ချီသော မှတ်တမ်းမှတ်ရာများ

 ကုမ္ပဏီ မှတ်ပုံတင်ပါ အချက်အလက်များ (စက်ဖြင့်အလိုအလျောက် ဖတ်ရှုနိုင်သော ဖော်မက်)
 ကုမ္ပဏီပေါင်း ၁၂၀၀၀၀ တို့၏ စာရွက်စာတမ်းများနှင့် ကုမ္ပဏီ အရာရှိများ၏ မှတ်ပုံတင် မိတ္တူများ
 အများနှင့်ဆိုင်သော တင်ဒါ ၃၀၀၀ကျော်
 ကုမ္ပဏီဆိုင်ရာ မြန်မာ ဥပဒေ စာရွက်စာတမ်းမျိုးစုံ
 ရွေးကောက်ပွဲဝင် ကိုယ်စားလှယ်လောင်းများကို တိုက်ဆိုင်စစ်ဆေးနိုင်သည့် ဘဏ္ဍာရေးနှင့် ကုမ္ပဏီဆိုင်ရာ အချက်အလက်မှတ်တမ်းများ

 AntiGovAnon Tweets
https://twitter.com/AntiGovAnon/status/1362901791508221954
https://twitter.com/AntiGovAnon/status/1362897209273044995

ဤဖိုင်များသည် Distributed Denial of Secrets (DDOS) မှ ဖော်ထုတ်ထားသော အချက်အလက် မှတ်တမ်းများ ဖြစ်ပါသည်။ သာမာန်မြန်မာပြည်သူများ ယခင်က တကြိမ်မှ သိရှိကြည့်ရှုခွင့် မရခဲ့သည့် စစ်တပ်နှင့် ၎င်းတို့၏အပေါင်းအပါ ခရိုနီများ၏ စီးပွားရေးလုပ်ငန်း အသေးစိပ် အချက်အလက်များကို ၃၃၀GBရှိသည့် မြန်မာ့ဘဏ္ဍာရေးဖိုင်များအဖြစ် DDOSက ဖော်ထုတ် ထုတ်ပြန်ခဲ့ပါသည်။ မြန်မာ့ဦးပိုင်လီမိတက်၏ မတရားအမြတ်ထုတ်မှုများကို ယင်းဖိုင်များမှတဆင့် မွှေနှောက်စုံစမ်း ဖော်ထုတ်ကြပါ။ ဖိုင်ဆိုက် ကြီးပါသည် ၃၃၀GB။ မိမိလုံခြုံရေးအတွက် VPN ခံပြီးမှ ဒေါင်းရန်အကြံပြုပါသည်။

topLevelComment.author: Dávid Töltésy
topLevelComment.text: Probably it is a very good tutorial video, but with the current Flutter version (1.22) it is not "compatible". The video starts with "Last time..." and there is no help where can I find that "last time" video. I installed flutter from his other videos, did everything but the hello world app was different than he is showing now. I manually created all the folders, files, copied the code from the video, and still, when I run the app, I can see the default Flutter Demo Home Page instead of the location_detail page. It is not the best video for beginners. Lots of important information is missing from the very beginning of the video. :(

replies.author: Dávid Töltésy
replies.text: Just a tip: start with the info on how to find the right blog post and the Github repo. You mention it at the 49th minute when a viewer is already halfway through the video. :(

topLevelComment.author: Ric Hard
topLevelComment.text:
If you (like me) wondered what happens on the dynamic routing part torwards the end and where the `settings` variable came from: the `_routes()` function actually does no routing but instead is `a function that returns a function accepting `RouteSettings` as a parameter`. This returned function then does the route-creation.

Instead (and more easy imo) you could define `_routes()` as:

`static Route<dynamic> _routes(RouteSettings settings) {`

and having it directly return the `MaterialPageRoute`, while invoking it like:

`onGenerateRoute: (RouteSettings settings) => _routes(settings),`

maybe it helps someone

replies.author: Ric Hard
replies.text: @Murrali Ramasamy hi. This looks kinda unrelated tbh. At some point there is a `null` returned when there actually should be a mapping returned (if you're on nullsafe this is worth an exception which may stop your program if not handled)

topLevelComment.author: Inayat Mohammed
topLevelComment.text:
⭐️ Contents ⭐️
(0:00) Intro:
⌨️ What this course covers

(2:15) Layout in Flutter:
⌨️ Layout concepts
⌨️ Column, mainAxisAlignment, crossAxisAlignment
⌨️ Container and Parameterized StatelessWidgets

(14:48) Images:
⌨️ Image, BoxConstraint
⌨️ Configuring image assets
⌨️ Implementing ImageBanner

(30:05) Text:
⌨️ Importing a custom font
⌨️ Finalizing our TextSection with Column and EdgeInsets
⌨️ ThemeData, TextTheme and organizing style

(48:30) Models:
⌨️ Using Models to represent data and functionality
⌨️ Making our screen dynamic
⌨️ Generics, map(), Anonymous Functions and Cascades

(69:33) Navigation and Lists:
⌨️ Parameterized named routes
⌨️ MaterialPageRoute, RouteFactory
⌨️ ListView and GestureDetector

replies.author: Juan Macias
replies.text:
Anish
1 month ago
Open VS Code and Install the flutter plugin from Extensions (Ctrl + Shift + X) . 
Follow instructions on-screen, Once done, Hold Ctrl + Shift + P , type flutter, select "...create project", enter a name, Click Enter, Select the folder where the app folder has to be created. After while you'll have to wait for it to be created. You shd see something like how his workspace looks
